analysis.Summary: Vue component rendering a sticky top navigation bar with a back button, dynamic title or logotype, shopping cart button, user profile icon and any custom action buttons defined in global state or route metadata. Uses smooth slide-in transitions for elements.
analysis.Purpose: Serves as the main header/navigation bar across application pages, providing consistent branding (title or logotype), navigation controls (back, profile), cart access and contextual action buttons.

Components.name: NavigationBar (this component)
Components.responsibility: Coordinates layout and rendering of header elements, manages navigation and action triggers.

Components.name: IconShopcart
Components.responsibility: SVG icon for shopping cart, rendered inside a Button to show cart status.

Components.name: IconProfile
Components.responsibility: SVG icon for user profile toggle/navigation.

Components.name: Button
Components.responsibility: Reusable button component used for toggling the shopping cart with counter badge.

Functions.name: handleBackNavigation
Functions.description: Navigates back in history or to 'Home' if the query parameter 'afterAuth' is present.

Functions.name: handleToggle
Functions.description: Checks authentication status: if not signed in, routes to 'Sign In', otherwise to the user's profile page.

Functions.name: actions (computed)
Functions.description: Reactive computed array of custom action definitions, sourcing from global state navigation_bar.actions or route.meta.actions.

Functions.name: formateText
Functions.description: Utility function (from globals store) to format the navigation title text, applied to either a custom name or localized route title or route name.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The raw title text to format.

analysis.Usage: Imported and placed in layout or page components (e.g. App.vue or specific route layouts) to provide a consistent header. Props 'theme' and optional 'logotype' can be passed to customize appearance.
Notes: Elements use Vue <transition> and <transition-group> with 'slideIn' classes for animated entry/exit.
Shows or hides back button and title based on route.meta.title_hide.
Cart button visibility controlled by route.meta.showShopCart or title_hide flag.
Supports arbitrary action components defined in global state or route metadata with custom condition, props and click handler.
Relies on a global 'formateText' utility from the globals store which must be present.
Responsive styling is handled via utility CSS classes; SCSS defines transition timing and transform behaviors.
